oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wake interaction between two side-by-side square cylinders in channel flow
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BURATTINI, P
AGRAWAL, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bluff body wake
Lattice Boltzmann method
Low Reynolds number
Coupled Landau equation
Wavelet analysis
LATTICE BOLTZMANN METHOD
LOW REYNOLDS-NUMBERS
CIRCULAR-CYLINDERS
COUPLED WAKES
FLOPPING REGIME
PAIR
TURBULENT
INTERFERENCE
SIMULATION
ARRANGEMENTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The flow around a pair of side-by-side square cylinders placed in a two-dimensional channel is computed using the lattice Boltzmann method. The Reynolds number is Re-d = dU(0)/v = 73 (d is the side of the cylinder, U-0 the upstream velocity, and v the kinematic viscosity of the fluid) while the lateral separations between the cylinders, s* equivalent to s/d, ranges between 0.5 and 6. Upon varying the cylinder spacing, in-phase, in-antiphase and quasi-periodic regimes are observed, by considering the lift and drag forces on the bodies. The relative coefficients vary substantially (in terms of mean and fluctuation rms values) in the range considered, while the Strouhal number is almost constant and near 0.16. The quasi-periodic regime, characterised by a second frequency much lower than the shedding, is studied in most detail. It is shown that the amplitude of the modulation follows a regular pattern in time that can be reproduced by a system of coupled Landau equations. (c) 2013 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
